file.name: openapi_spec.yaml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.0 info: title: Engagespot API description: >- Our REST API allows you to send notifications to users on your app, and to do actions like Fetch Notifications, Delete Notification etc on behalf of them. ## Base URL Base URL of this API is `https://api.engagespot.co/v3/` ## Authentication This API should be authenticated in two ways. **Authenticate using API-KEY and API-SECRET** This mode is required when you want to authenticate as your Engagespot app and send a notification to one or more recipients. The credentials can be found in your Engagespot dashboard. **Authenticate using API-KEY and USER-ID** This mode should be used when you want to authenticate as your user and want to perform actions on behalf of them. For example, reading the notification inbox of a user, deleting a notification from a user's inbox etc. These authentication parameters should be passed via headers. | **Header Parameter** | **Description** | | --- | --- | | X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY | Your Engagespot API Key. You can see this on your Engagespot dashboard. | | X-ENGAGESPOT-API-SECRET | Your Engagespot API Secret. You can see this on your Engagespot dashboard.
**You should never use this secret on any front-end apps.** | | X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID | Your user's unique identifier such as their email id that you used to register them on Engagespot. | | X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE | This is optional. You need this param only if you have turned on [HMAC Authentication](docs/HMAC-authentication/enabling-HMAC-authentication) for your app in Engagespot Dashboard.

Your user's HMAC signature can be generated in your server as follows -
`createHmac('sha256', Your_API_Secret).update(user_Id, 'utf8').digest('base64');`
| version: 3.0.0 servers: - url: https://api.engagespot.co tags: - name: Notifications description: End points to manage notifications in your app. - name: Profile - name: Preferences - name: Category description: Lists all categories in this app. paths: /v3/notifications: post: tags: - Notifications summary: /notifications description: >- Sends a new notification to one or more recipients. This request accepts an optional `override` object that you can use to override several configurations specified in your Engagespot. It can also override Provider specific configs and also to directly specify any additional properties supported by your provider. Read more about providers and their available override configurations from our [docs](https://documentation.engagespot.co/docs/channels/what-are-providers#overriding-configurations-via-api) requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: object required: [notification, recipients] properties: notification: type: object properties: templateId: type: number description: If you want to send a templated notification, just specify the template id which you get from Engagespot dashboard. And no need to use `title` or any other fields. title: type: string description: If you are not using the `templateId` field, then title is mandatory. message: type: string url: type: string icon: type: string recipients: type: array description: Unique id's of your users to send this notification to. items: type: string category: type: string description: Category identifier to tag this notification. If category doesn't exist, it will be created. For templated notifications, no need to use this field because category can be specified when you create the template using Engagespot dashboard. data: type: object description: Add any key value pair or meta data to be passed along with this notification. This will also be used to replace the placeholders (if you're using templates) override: type: object description: Override delivery preferences configured in your account. properties: channels: type: array description: >- Specify the channels through which this notification should be delivered. See [Channels](/docs/channels/what-are-channels) to get the complete list of supported channels. items: type: string sendgrid_email: type: object description: >- Overrides Sendgrid configuration specified in your Engagespot dashboard. This is considered only if you've enabled Sendgrid email provider. The first property _config is used by Engagespot to override your Sendgrid default configuration specified in the dashboard. Along with _config (Not inside _config), You can pass any property as supported by the Sendgrid's mail send API. properties: _config: type: object properties: API_KEY: type: string description: Override Sendgrid API_KEY mentioned in your dashboard. FROM_EMAIL: type: string description: Email to be used in the 'from' field. FROM_NAME: type: string description: Name to be used in the 'from' field. smtp_email: type: object description: >- Overrides SMTP Provider configurations specified in your Engagespot dashboard. This is considered only if you have enabled SMTP Email Provider. properties: SMTP_HOST: type: string SMTP_PORT: type: string SECURE: type: boolean REQUIRE_TLS: type: boolean SMTP_USERNAME: type: string SMTP_PASSWORD: type: string FROM_NAME: type: string FROM_EMAIL: type: string subject: type: string description: Email subject text: type: string description: Plain text email body. html: type: string description: HTML Email body. headers: type: object description: Any key value pair headers to be passed along with the email attachments: description: Attachments as accepted by Nodemailer (https://nodemailer.com/message/attachments/) example: notification: title: Rose accepted your friend request recipients: - jack@example.com override: channels: - email - webPush parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true description: Your Engagespot app's api key which can be found in your dashboard. in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-SECRET description: Your Engagespot app's api secret which can be found in your dashboard. in: header required: true schema: type: string example: 7rd9fahc6f5tam9ccdrig3h7j15b6cd0jc79708d4814j7ia responses: '202': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} '401': description: Authentication failed content: application/json: { 'message': "Authentication failed. Make sure you're using the right API Credentials. Please read our docs at https://documentation.engagespot.co", } get: tags: - Notifications summary: /notifications description: This API returns list of notifications for the given user. parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY in: header required: true schema: type: string example: shiynklpz18l3ktqyy6d9a - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: yourUser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE - name: '' in: header schema: type: string responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: schema: type: object description: >- Returns the notification list along with pagination details properties: unreadCount: type: number description: The unread notification count. pagination: type: object properties: totalCount: type: number description: Total number of notifications. data: type: array description: List of notifications for this user. items: type: object properties: id: type: number description: Id of notification title: type: string description: Notification title message: type: string description: Body of notification icon: type: string description: URL of image data: type: object description: Custom key value pair (JSON) createdAt: type: string description: Notification created at timestamp seenAt: type: string description: Notification Seen timestamp clickedAt: type: string description: Notification Clicked timestamp /v3/notifications/428107: get: tags: - Notifications summary: /notifications/:notificationId description: Gets the details of a notification parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: shiynklpz18l3ktqyy6d9a - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: yourUser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} /v3/notifications/markAllNotificationsAsSeen: post: tags: - Notifications summary: /markAllNotificationsAsSeen description: Marks all notifications as "seen" for the given user. requestBody: content: {} parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: shiynklpz18l3ktqyy6d9a - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: yourUser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} /v3/notifications/{notificationId}/click: post: tags: - Notifications summary: /notifications/:id/click description: Marks a notification as clicked. requestBody: content: {} parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: shiynklpz18l3ktqyy6d9a - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: yourUser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE - name: notificationId in: path schema: type: integer required: true example: '428152' responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} /v3/notifications/428019/: delete: tags: - Notifications summary: /notifications/:id description: Deletes a notification parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: shiynklpz18l3ktqyy6d9a - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: yourUser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} /v3/profile: patch: tags: - Profile summary: /profile description: >- Sets one or more key value pairs to User's profile. This method expects array of JSON Patch rules as mentioned in [JSON Patch](http://jsonpatch.com/) syntax to do complex operations the existing user object. requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: array items: type: object description: JSON Patch Operation as mentioned in [JSON Patch](http://jsonpatch.com/) example: - op: 'replace' path: '/email' value: 'jack@titanic.com' parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: youruser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On for your app. example: jYt501jhd736hcbcGt34D6HyCxdFrEhkskpurgs36bbK6Xxzl1Lp responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} /v3/profile: put: tags: - Profile summary: /profile description: >- Sets one or more key value pairs to User's profile. Simply pass the JSON profile object of the user, and we'll update the existing profile. requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: object description: Key value pairs for the user's profile example: name: 'Jack' email: 'jack@titanic.com' parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: youruser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On for your app. example: jYt501jhd736hcbcGt34D6HyCxdFrEhkskpurgs36bbK6Xxzl1Lp responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} get: tags: - Profile summary: /profile description: Gets a user's profile. parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: youruser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} /v3/preferences: get: tags: - Preferences summary: /preferences description: Gets a user's profile. parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: youruser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} patch: tags: - Preferences summary: /preferences description: Set notification delivery preference on notification categories and channels. requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: object required: [preference] description: Array of preference objects for each category properties: preference: type: array items: type: object required: [categoryId, channels] properties: categoryId: type: number description: Category Id. (You'll get this from GET categories API) channels: type: array items: type: object required: [channel, enabled] properties: channel: type: string description: Channel Identifier. See [Channels](/docs/channels/what-are-channels) to get the complete list of supported channels. required: true enabled: type: boolean description: Whether notifications from this channel should be enabled for this category. required: true example: preference: - categoryId: 1 channels: - channel: inApp enabled: true parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: youruser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER_SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: {} /v3/categories: get: tags: - Category summary: /categories description: Lists all categories in the app. parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: youruser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: schema: type: array items: type: object properties: id: type: number description: Category Id name: type: string description: Name of the category identifier: type: string description: Category Identifier post: tags: - Category summary: /categories description: Create a new category. requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: object required: ['identifier', 'name'] properties: identifier: type: string description: A unique identifier for the new category (Example - comment_replies) name: type: string description: A name for the new category (Example - Comment Replies). This will be shown to your users. parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-SECRET-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: Ht410rCJ09Hy8Uyzwpsm6s4jjqmlx responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: id: type: number description: Category Id name: type: string description: Name of the category identifier: type: string description: Category Identifier delete: tags: - Category summary: /categories/:id description: Deletes a category. parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-SECRET-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: Ht410rCJ09Hy8Uyzwpsm6s4jjqmlx responses: '200': description: Successful response /v3/sdk/connect: post: tags: - SDK summary: /sdk/connect description: >- API to authenticate your app user with Engagespot. This API is called from every front-end SDK's initialization step. If you're using a front-end platform that do not have a native SDK support from Engagespot, you can simply use this API. requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: object required: ['deviceType', 'browserType'] properties: deviceType: type: string description: Should be any value from - "browser", "android", "ios" parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string example: youruser@example.com - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-DEVICE-ID required: true in: header schema: type: string description: Any unique id to identify your user's device / app installation. example: Any value - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-USER-SIGNATURE in: header schema: type: string description: Required If HMAC Authentication is Turned On example: USER-SIGNATURE responses: '200': description: Successful response content: application/json: schema: type: object description: >- Returns the app details, categories and also the current unread notification count for the user you've authenticated. properties: unreadCount: type: number description: The unread notification count for the user you've authenticated app: type: object properties: id: type: string description: Id of your Engagespot app categories: type: array description: List of categories in this app. items: type: object properties: id: type: number description: Category Id name: type: string description: Name of the category '401': description: Unauthorized /v3/users/: post: tags: - Users summary: /users description: >- API to create a new user requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: object required: ['identifier'] properties: identifier: type: string description: Any identifier to uniquely identify your user. profile: type: object description: Any key value pair that will be attached to the user's profile parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-SECRET required: true in: header schema: type: string example: Xt41rizwprizwpqmlxkriZwpk7huInx responses: '200': description: Successful response '401': description: Unauthorized /v3/users/{identifier}: put: tags: - Users summary: /users/:identifier description: >- Create or update a User with profile data requestBody: content: application/json: schema: type: object description: Any key value pair to be attached to this user's profile parameters: - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-KEY required: true in: header schema: type: string example: at410rizwpsm6s4jjqmlx - name: X-ENGAGESPOT-API-SECRET required: true in: header schema: type: string example: Xt41rizwprizwpqmlxkriZwpk7huInx responses: '200': description: Successful response '401': description: Unauthorized '422': description: Unprocessable entity. Usually happens if you include a profile parameter named 'identifier'

Error:
unmarshal: yaml: unmarshal errors:
  yaml: line 604: cannot unmarshal !!bool `true` into []string
